intro: Anthanema, commonly known as the "flower of the sea," is a coastal plant that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is often found growing along shorelines and dunes. The plant has small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Anthanema is a low-growing perennial with succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Its ability to withstand salt spray makes it an important part of coastal ecosystems.
